intro: Brya racemosa, commonly known as the clustered moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a prostrate growth habit with closely spaced, overlapping leaves that are usually green to reddish in color. Its reproductive structures, called capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Brya racemosa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for other organisms in its ecosystem.
